revised_title: Infrared Radiation and Protostars: The Formation and Evolution of Stellar Systems
tldr: This article discusses the formation and evolution of protostars, focusing on the role of infrared radiation in the process. The author explains how interstellar gas clouds collapse and form clusters of protostars, which can be detected as high-luminosity infrared objects. The article also explores the dynamics of these collapsing clouds, the resulting fragments, and the formation of disks around protostars.
